item.title: Alar‚Äôs new update makes the dictionary faster and easier to build on
item.description: In 2020, we did something very odd. Well, K (Kailash, CTO) did. He helped open-source Alar, a Kannada‚ÄìEnglish dictionary. It’s a little absurd, considering we’re a stockbroking company, but the project itself is one of monumental importance. The story of how Alar came to be is even more inspiring. It was essentially the life’s work of one man: V. Krishna. Alar is the online version of what he had built over 40 years‚Äîresearching, writing, and cataloguing more than 150,000 Kannada words and 240,000 English definitions, complete with all their attendant details.

item.title: Take break from trading using Kill Switch
item.description: The other common trading mistake I have seen over and over again in all my years of being a trader and running a brokerage is over-trading and revenge trading. Sometimes, the best trade is the one you don’t take. This is why we launched Kill Switch. If you get the urge to keep trading, you can enable it, and you won’t be able to place trades for the rest of the day.

item.title: Teaching finance and markets online with Varsity Live
item.description: I think we’ve finally found a way to teach finance and markets online with both quality and scale with Varsity Live. We’ve had 2.3 lakh registrations so far, with about 3,000 new people signing up every week. By the way, this Sunday, the 23rd, we’re hosting a finance boot camp for kids. Most of this is a result of people discovering Varsity Live and sharing it with their friends and family.

item.title: The love we get for all the content is crazy
item.description: The love we get for all the content on Varsity, Markets by Zerodha etc. is crazy. üòÄWhat we’ve done from day 1 is focus on sharing quality insights rather than chasing engagement, pointless optimizations, and gimmicks. The trust we’ve built over almost a decade is a direct result of that‚Äîpeople reading and watching us and then sharing it with their friends and family.

item.title: Prayoga students contribute to Global Science
item.description: Here’s something awesome üòç Reshma, Lakshmi, Kirat, and Yamini are four young 8th- and 9th-standard girls from rural and socially disadvantaged communities in Karnataka. They published a scientific research paper in a peer-reviewed international journal on an innovative method for synthesizing copper oxide nanoparticles for water purification, with the help of three researchers from Prayoga. What’s even more impressive is that these girls are the first in their families to go to school.

item.title: Introducing the Money Mindful series
item.description: Despite all the interest in the stock market after COVID, there are still only 5 crore unique mutual fund investors. I’ve said this earlier as well‚Äîone of the biggest challenges for the Indian markets is the lack of an advisory ecosystem with just about 900 RIAs. If you consider mutual fund distributors, there are about 2.7 lakh+ plus, but still not enough. For a broad comparison, there are over 27 lakh+ insurance agents.

item.title: Money mistakes are the best form of financial literacy
item.description: One good thing about all the post-pandemic excess in the stock market is that the Indian stock market has become a lot younger. Of course, many of these young investors are doing a lot of things they shouldn’t be doing. But they are better off making all the mistakes when they are young and have very little to lose, than later in life when they have more money and responsibilities.

item.title: Update on all our educational content initiatives
item.description: Some people, jokingly perhaps, say, “Zerodha is a content company.” But this isn’t something we are doing now. We’ve been sharing everything we know about finance, markets, and investing since day 1 of Zerodha in text form‚Äîeven before “content” was a thing. In fact, Z-Connect is one of the oldest finance blogs in India. It’s just that now we are publishing a lot more video content across @ZerodhaVarsity, @zerodhamarkets, @zerodhaonline, @Rainmatterin, Zero1 and there’s @nikhilkamathcio’s WTF and @kmr_dilip’s The Other Side as well.

item.title: Introducing Varsity Live
item.description: If you want to learn anything about trading, investing, and personal finance, I don’t think there’s a better place than @ZerodhaVarsity. The idea of Varsity began with a random email I sent to @karthikrangappa in 2014, and today, it’s one of the most popular free and open resources for all things stock markets, not just in India but maybe globally. The website has over 15 comprehensive modules and gets millions of hits.
